Introduction.Name: The Empire

Magic.Name: Lore of Fire
Magic.Alternative: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic

Introduction.Annotation:
The Empire, sometimes referred to as the Empire of Man, is an electoral monarchy composed of feudal states that is the largest and most important of the Human nations in the Old World. It was forged by the warrior-king and ascended deity Sigmar from the primitive tribes of Human barbarians who inhabited what became the lands of the southern Empire more than 2500 years ago.

Although not as skilled in craftsmanship as the Dwarfs or in magic as the High Elves, the people of the Empire are not beholden by the limits of tradition to the same extent as those elder races and continue to progress culturally, technologically and magically.

Having yet to succumb to any threat, external or internal, it is the faith, the sense of righteousness, and the unconquerable spirit of the realm's citizens which gives the Empire its strength, as well as the ruthless efficiency of its military and religious orders.

Artefact.Name: Runefang
Artefact.Description: All hits from a Runefang wound automatically and allow no armour saves.

Artefact.Name: The Mace of Helsturm
Artefact.Description: The bearer can forfeit all of his normal Attacks to make only one Attack. Roll to hit normally. If this one Attack hits, the hit is resolved at Strength 10 and causes D6 wounds.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Sigismund
Artefact.Description: The wielder of this sword strikes with +1 Strength and benefits from the 'always strikes first' special rule in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Fate
Artefact.Rule: At the beginning of the battle, nominate one enemy character or monster. The sword counts as a magic sword with no particular bonuses against any other opponent, but attacks directed against the designated target will wound it on a 2+ and cause D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the battle, nominate one enemy character or monster. The sword counts as a magic sword with no particular bonuses against any other opponent, but attacks directed against the designated target will wound it on a 2+ and cause D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Power
Artefact.Description: The sword confers +2 Strength to all close combat attacks made by the character.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Righteous Steel
Artefact.Description: The wielder always hits any opponent on a 2+, regardless of relative Weapon Skills. This cannot be modified in any way.

Artefact.Name: Hammer of Judgement
Artefact.Description: Models hit by this hammer must take a Toughness test for every hit suffered. If the test is failed, the hit wounds automatically and no armour save is allowed. If the test is passed, roll to wound and take armour saves as normal.

Artefact.Name: Dragon Bow
Artefact.Rule: The Dragon Bow has a range of 36" and Strength 6. Any hits from this bow count as being from a magical weapon
Artefact.Description: The Dragon Bow has a range of 36" and Strength 6. Any hits from this bow count as being from a magical weapon.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Justice
Artefact.Description: The bearer can re-roll failed rolls to wound.

Artefact.Name: Wyrmslayer Sword
Artefact.Description: Hits from this sword wound any opponent on a roll of 4+ (unless the wielder's Strength would make this less). Armour saves apply as normal, modified by the Strength of the character, but large targets lose their armour save due to the scaly skin special rule against hits from this sword.

Artefact.Name: The Gilded Armour
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. Models attacking the wearer in close combat must pass a Strength test before rolling to hit for every Attack directed at the target. If the test is failed, the Attack is lost. Special Attacks (like those of a Giant, impact hits and anything not included in the Attacks value on a model's profile) are not affected.

Artefact.Name: Dawn Armour
Artefact.Description: Full plate armour (armour save 4+). The model can re-roll any failed armour save.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Tarnus
Artefact.Description: Light armour. The Armour of Tarnus confers a 5+ ward save to the wearer.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Meteoric Iron
Artefact.Description: This armour gives the bearer a 1+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means.

Artefact.Name: Helm of the Ratslayer
Artefact.Rule: Causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army
Artefact.Description: This helm confers a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally (including normal armour and a shield). In addition, the wearer causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army.

Artefact.Name: Shield of the Gorgon
Artefact.Rule: Can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack
Artefact.Description: Shield. The wearer can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack. In the case of models with different Attacks (eg, mounted models) the wearer chooses which Attack is lost. Special Attacks (like those of a Giant, impact hits and anything not included in the Attacks value on a model's profile) are not affected.

Artefact.Name: Bronze Shield
Artefact.Rule: Ignores the first hit in the battle from shooting or close combat
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer ignores the first hit in the battle from shooting or close combat.

Artefact.Name: Shroud of Magnus
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Artefact.Description: This item gives the bearer a 5+ Ward save and magic resistance (2).

Artefact.Name: Holy Relic
Artefact.Description: The Holy Relic gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Jade Amulet
Artefact.Description: The model may ignore the first wound it suffers.

Artefact.Name: The White Cloak
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: This item gives a 5+ ward save, which is increased to 2+ against Flaming Attacks.

Artefact.Name: The Crimson Amulet
Artefact.Rule: Automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests)
Artefact.Description: This item gives a 6+ ward save. The wearer automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests).

Artefact.Name: Sigil of Sigmar
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: The Sigil of Sigmar confers magic resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Seal of Destruction
Artefact.Rule: Once automatically dispel an enemy spell, on a 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it
Artefact.Description: One use only. The seal has the same effect as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, roll a D6. On a result of 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it. Spells cast from a bound item will only be removed on the result of a 6.

Artefact.Name: Grey Wand
Artefact.Rule: +1 to the casting attempts
Artefact.Description: Gives +1 to the casting attempts made by the Wizard.

Artefact.Name: Rod of Power
Artefact.Rule: Can save up to three unused power/dispel dice from the pool and store them, at the beginning of each successive magic phase roll a dice, if the result is equal or higher to the number of dice stored, add them to the power/dispel dice pool
Artefact.Description: At the end of each magic phase (yours and enemy's), you can save up to three unused power/dispel dice from the pool and store them in the rod. At the beginning of each successive magic phase (yours and enemy's), roll a dice. If the result is equal or higher to the number of dice stored, add them to the power/dispel dice pool, if the result is lower than the number of dice stored, they are lost.

Artefact.Name: Luckstone
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle, can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel
Artefact.Description: One use only. Once per battle, the bearer can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel a spell. This can effectively cancel a miscast result, and cause irresistible force or a miscast.

Artefact.Name: Crystal Ball
Artefact.Rule: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units that are within 24" of the Wizard at any time
Artefact.Description: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units that are within 24" of the Wizard at any time. This includes which magic items are in the unit and who is carrying them, the presence of disguised, hidden or otherwise 'invisible' models and everything else that the player is not normally obliged to disclose to his opponent.

Artefact.Name: Wizard's Staff
Artefact.Rule: Use one more dice than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell
Artefact.Description: The Wizard's Staff allows the bearer to use one more dice than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell (eg, a Wizard that can normally use up to two dice to cast spells will be able to use up to three dice).

Artefact.Name: Laurels of Victory
Artefact.Rule: Each wound caused by a model wearing the Laurels of Victory will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution
Artefact.Description: Each wound caused by a model wearing the Laurels of Victory (but not those caused by his mount) will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution. Note that you do not actually cause double wounds on your victim!

Artefact.Name: Rod of Command
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle, instead rolling the dice for Break test, the player can declare he is using Rod of Command and the character (and his unit) automatically passing Break test
Artefact.Description: One use only. Whenever the character (and the unit he is with) have to take a Break test, instead of rolling the dice, the player can declare he is using this item. If the player decides to do so, the character (and his unit) automatically roll double Is (Insane Courage!) for the test, automatically passing it regardless of modifiers. This item cannot be used by a character in a turn he refused a challenge or if he is hiding at the back of the unit (nobody would pay heed to such a coward!)

Artefact.Name: Aldred's Casket of Sorcery
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, power level variable: at the end of each of his movement phases, the bearer may remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard within 12" of him on a roll of 4+, the bearer can then cast the captured spell in any of his own following magic phases
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level variable. At the end of each of his movement phases, the bearer may remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard within 12" of him on a roll of 4+. The bearer can then cast the captured spell in any of his own following magic phases by releasing it from the casket just like from a bound item, whereupon the spell is then removed from the game. Any number of spells may be captured by the casket, and the bearer can cast each one once, either over several magic phases or all at the same time if he prefers. The power level of the spell cast by the casket will be equivalent to the normal casting value of the spell.

Artefact.Name: The Silver Horn
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, power level 5: if successfully cast, all fleeing friendly units on the battlefield will rally immediately, regardless of the number of models left
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level 5. If successfully cast, all fleeing friendly units on the battlefield will rally immediately, regardless of the number of models left.

Artefact.Name: The Orb of Thunder
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, power level 4: when the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, flying creatures on the battlefield cannot fly and must move on the ground at their normal Movement rate, remains in play
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level 4. Remains in play. When the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, flying creatures on the battlefield cannot fly and must move on the ground at their normal Movement rate.

Artefact.Name: Doomfire Ring
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, power level 3: casts the Burning Head spell from the Lore of Fire
Artefact.Description: Bound Spell: Power Level 3. The Doomfire Ring casts the Burning Head spell from the Lore of Fire.

Artefact.Name: Van Horstmann's Speculum
Artefact.Rule: When the wearer fights a challenge he can 'swap' his base Weapon Skill, Strength, Toughness, Initiative and Attacks values with those of his enemy
Artefact.Description: When the wearer fights a challenge he can 'swap' his base Weapon Skill, Strength, Toughness, Initiative and Attacks values with those of his enemy. He can choose not to use the mirror, but if he does he must swap all these characteristics for the duration of the challenge. So, the wearer fights with his enemy's WS, S, T, I and A whilst his enemy fights with the wearer's WS, S, T, I and A.

Artefact.Name: Icon of Magnus
Artefact.Rule: The character and the unit he is with are immune to Fear; when faced with an enemy that causes Terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer Fear, not Terror
Artefact.Description: The character and the unit he is with are immune to Fear. When faced with an enemy that causes Terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer Fear, not Terror.

Artefact.Name: Ring of Volans
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell: power level variable, one use only: choose any one of the eight magic lores in the Warhammer rulebook and randomly select one spell from that lore to be bound within the Ring of Volans
Artefact.Description: One use only. Bound Spell: Power Level variable. Choose any one of the eight magic lores in the Warhammer rulebook and randomly select one spell from that lore to be bound within the Ring of Volans. The power level of the spell cast by the ring will be equivalent to the normal casting value of the spell.

Artefact.Name: Imperial Banner
Artefact.Rule: All units within 12" can re-roll any failed Terror, Fear, Panic or Rally test as well as tests to avoid pursuing a fleeing enemy
Artefact.Description: All units with at least one model within 12" of the Imperial Banner can re-roll any failed Terror, Fear, Panic or Rally test as well as tests to avoid pursuing a fleeing enemy.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Sigismund
Artefact.Description: The standard bearer and all models in his unit are Stubborn. Note that this bonus is also conferred to other characters within the unit.

Artefact.Name: Griffon Standard
Artefact.Rule: A unit counts double its rank bonus when it comes to working out combat results
Artefact.Description: A unit joined by a Battle Standard Bearer carrying the Griffon Standard counts double its rank bonus when it comes to working out combat results. If the unit is in two ranks it receives +2, in three ranks +4, and in four ranks (the maximum bonus) +6. The unit will never pursue a fleeing enemy, but will always hold its ground, even if affected by a special rule that means it must normally do so.

Artefact.Name: Banner of the Daemonslayer
Artefact.Description: During the turn when it charges into combat, the unit causes Fear (from the moment it is found to be in charge range to the end of that turn).

Artefact.Name: Banner of Valour
Artefact.Description: The unit is Immune to Panic.

Artefact.Name: Standard of Arcane Warding
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Artefact.Description: This banner confers Magic Resistance (2) on the unit that carries it.

Artefact.Name: Steel Standard
Artefact.Rule: The unit can add D3" to its charge move. If the charge is failed, the unit will move forward 7" as normal
Artefact.Description: The unit can add D3" to its charge move. If the charge is failed, the unit will move forward 7" as normal.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Duty
Artefact.Rule: The unit can re-roll any failed Rally test
Artefact.Description: The unit can re-roll any failed Rally test.

Individual.Rule: Knows all six spell from Lore of metal list

RangeWeapon.Name: Al-kahest
RangeWeapon.Rule: Attack with range of 6", wounding any target on a 4+, no armour save

Armour.Name: The Cloak of Molten Metal
Armour.Rule: 3+ ward save against any missle attack
